value.title: Can Artificial Intelligence Ever Be Truly Creative?
value.excerpt: When Jane Goodall discovered chimpanzees using tools — bending sticks into just the right shape to penetrate a termite mound, drawing out the insects like fish on a hook — she caused an outcry. “The Toolmaker” could no longer be our species’ special title and people had a collective identity crisis.
